title: Introducing: The Death Of Pop
body:
With a purposefully rather ironic name, London duo **The Death Of Pop** prove that pop music is very much alive and kicking in 2013.

Having uploaded their two debut tracks only hours ago, alongside the creation of their [Facebook](http://www.facebook.com/TheDeathOfPop?fref=ts) page, it’s all wonderfully considered and echoes the warm, fuzzy jangle of the music itself. Comprised of **Angus James** and **Oliver James** (presumably relatives or some sort – brothers/cousins?), the two tracks in question are glorious slices of candy-floss pop, melting in the ears like Aero bubbles on the tongue. _Don’t Hang Around_ is somewhere between the **Beach Boys** and **The Drums**, with it’s tales of unrequited love pitted against quilt-soft harmonies. _“I’m in love with a girl who’s in love with a girl who’s in love with the boy next door / he’s in love with himself wants nobody else, I’m not going to take it no more”_ may well be the most twee line penned in 2013, and given that we’re only hours into the year, I can assure you I understand just how bold a claim that may appear to be. If this is **The Death Of Pop**, then bring it on. Check out _Don’t Hang Around_ and _Nowhere_ below.
